description: From Middle English rawe, raw, rau, from Old English hrēaw (“raw, uncooked”), from Proto-West Germanic *hrau, from Proto-Germanic *hrawaz, *hrēwaz (“raw”), from Proto-Indo-European *krewh₂- (“raw meat, fresh blood”).

Cognate with Scots raw (“raw”), Dutch rauw (“raw”), German roh (“raw”), Swedish rå (“raw”), Icelandic hrár (“raw”), Latin crūdus (“raw, bloody, uncooked”), Irish cró (“blood”), Lithuanian kraujas (“blood”), Russian кровь (krovʹ, “blood”). Related also to Old English hrēow, hrēoh (“rough, fierce, wild, angry, disturbed, troubled, sad, stormy, tempestuous”). More at ree.

examples: There's nothing but raw eggs for breakfast.

entries.meaning: (of materials, products, etc.) Not treated or processed; in a natural state, unrefined, unprocessed. [from 10th c.]
Having had the skin removed or abraded; chafed, tender; exposed, lacerated. [from 14th c.]
Crude in quality; rough, uneven, unsophisticated. [from 16th c.]
(statistics, of data) Uncorrected, without analysis. [from 20th c.]
examples: What makes Mexico worrying is not just the raw numbers but the power of the cartels over society.

entries.meaning: (of an emotion, personality, etc.) Unmasked, undisguised, strongly expressed.
Candid in a representation of unpleasant facts, conditions, etc.
examples: a raw description of the American political arena

entries.meaning: (of language) Unrefined, crude, or insensitive, especially with reference to sexual matters.
(sugar refining, sugar trade) An unprocessed sugar; a batch of such.
examples: With the recent advance in London yellow crystals, however, the disproportion of the relative value of these two kinds has been considerably reduced, and a better demand for crystallized raws should consequently occur.

entries.meaning: A galled place; an inveterate sore.
(by extension, figurative) A point about which a person is particularly sensitive.
examples: In a moment Tom was angry. The women saw that Bill had touched him upon the raw, and they went out of the room to prepare a meal.

entries.meaning: (anime fandom slang) A recording or rip of a show that has not been fansubbed.
(manga fandom slang) A scan that has not been cleaned (purged of blemishes arising from the scanning process) and has not been scanlated.

verbs.description: raw (third-person singular simple present raws, present participle rawing, simple past and past participle rawed)

entries.meaning: (slang) To anally or vaginally penetrate without a condom.
